results.title: The Philippines: the furthest cross
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Don Murray, John Temple, Roan Hannam, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the historical and cultural background of the Philippines. A well-photographed and interesting documentary. Photography by Dean Semler. Unit Manager Damien Parer.

results.title: Indonesia
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
What makes this diverse chain of islands into a nation? Indonesia’s national motto “Unity in diversity” is the film’s starting point in its concentration on Sumatra, Java and Bali - the most populated areas. One of the most interesting sequences is an examination of the Indonesian concept of power - that there is a finite amount of it in the world. Another highlight is the Indonesian Army and its role as an essential ingredient in society - not, as so often in the West, as something appended to, or imposed on, society.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland Press

results.title: Thailand
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Don Murray, John Temple, Roan Hannam, ABC, Film Australia and University of Queensland
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”
A look at the historical and cultural background of Thailand. Focuses on the respect the Thais have for the monks and their religion, and the veneration of the monarchy.

results.title: Hong Kong, Singapore: fragrant harbour, lion city
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, John Temple, ABC, Film Australia and Queensland University of Technology
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Asian insight”.
A look at the cultural background of Hong Kong and Singapore. Both places are governed by the professional elite ruling class. However, they have produced very different societies under the pressure of history and circumstances. Sujitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Artists at Work
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: School of Paris (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Artists at Work”.
Five contemporary artists at work in Paris: Dewasne, working in pure colours, primaries dominating, the work somewhere between music and architecture; Di Teana, at work in steel, winner of the Prix de Saint Goba, 1962; Fruhtrunk - bands orange to black, the colours play as a Bach fugue; Weisbuch - continues the Daumier tradition - and winner of the Prix de la Critique for the best show in Paris, 1961; and Hartung - one of the most important influences on abstract, and prize winner at the Venice Biennale, 1960.
